image.altText: A large smoke plume can be seen over the skyline of Tehran.

props.synopsis: US officials reportedly say President Donald Trump blocked an Israeli plan to kill Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei as Israel and Iran launch fresh attacks on each other for a fourth day. Follow live.

title.children: Netanyahu says Tehran is 'burning' as Iran accuses Israel of hitting civilian sites

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu holds up his right hand.

props.synopsis: There are many things happening in the Middle East at the moment but beneath them lies one single through-line: Israel is attempting to reshape the political map of the region.

title.children: Netanyahu's agenda is clear, but Trump wants plausible deniability

image.altText: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei.

props.synopsis: Residents in the Iranian capital Tehran are reportedly leaving the city after a barrage of strikes on Sunday, as both sides trade heavy blows for a third straight day.

title.children: Donald Trump reportedly vetoed plan to kill Iran's supreme leader

image.altText: A man looks at flames rising from an oil storage facility

props.synopsis: The oil price surged more than 7 per cent on Friday after news of the attack hit commodity traders' screens, and any thought of the price staying below $US60 a barrel this year now seems dead.

title.children: This crisis could be disastrous for the global economy

image.altText: Australian writer Alistair Kitchen stands holding a laptop he says he was denied entry to the United States

props.synopsis: Melbourne writer Alistair Kitchen was detained for 12 hours at Los Angeles International Airport, had his phone seized and was "interrogated" about his views on the conflict in the Middle East.

title.children: Australian denied entry to US after being grilled on Israel-Gaza views

image.altText: Donald Trump points at someone with his right hand index finger.

props.synopsis: Key defence figures on both sides of the Atlantic warn the risks to AUKUS run deeper than whether a review finds it is "America first" enough for Donald Trump.

title.children: 'No penalties, no refunds': US quitting AUKUS would leave Australia high and dry

image.altText: Adam Scott crouches to assess a putt at the US Open.

props.synopsis: Players are back out on course after heavy rain stopped play with Adam Scott just one stroke off the lead on the eighth hole in the fourth round of the US Open. Follow live.

title.children: Adam Scott second at US Open as rain returns on brutal course

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 9th hole: Scott one shot back as leaders turn for home
We're back, and Adam Scott misses the green badly
What has happened this morning at Oakmont?

image.altText: Anthony Albanese in a suit at a microphone in front of a wall of plants.

props.synopsis: As the Australian prime minister prepares to meet with the US president for their first face-to-face meeting, only one is leading a country where democracy is thriving and the public isn't bitterly divided.

title.children: Australia is having a 'democracy bounce'. Trump could learn a lesson

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wearing a black suit jacket, white shirt and red tie while waving outside the entry door of a plane

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has arrived in Canada for the G7 summit, where he is due to hold talks with Mark Carney this morning. Follow live.

title.children: PM touches down in Canada for talks with world leaders at G7 summit

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Albanese, Trump to build 'rapport' during G7 talks
Marles concerned about escalation of conflict in region
Albanese's gift of choice for new Canada PM

image.altText: A female doctor carrying a stethoscope.

props.synopsis: A Grattan Institute report has found one in five Australians have been charged an "extreme" specialist fee, as out-of-pocket costs and public waitlists soar.

title.children: 'Left on autopilot': Calls to rethink specialist system after extreme fees

image.altText: Jim Rogers and his partner Tyler.

props.synopsis: There were signs for years that something was wrong, and Jim Rogers's doctor put it down to stress. But when the 55-year-old couldn't silence his phone, his world began to unravel.

title.children: The early signs of dementia that Jim missed for years

image.altText: Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris collide at Canadian Grand Prix

props.synopsis: McLaren's Formula 1 championship rivals Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris crash into each other, as Mercedes driver George Russell triumphs at the Canadian Grand Prix.

title.children: 'Stupid from me': Piastri and Norris crash in F1 championship flashpoint

image.altText: A man with facial hair wearing a high-vis vest.

props.synopsis: Chinese-owned company Landbridge has come out in defence of its operation of Darwin Port, as the federal government negotiates to get the facility back "under Australian control".

title.children: Could the US and China battle it out for control of this key Australian asset?

image.altText: Virgin Australian and Qantas flights listed on an airport departures board

props.synopsis: Qantas, Air New Zealand and a rejuvenated Virgin Australia are putting the pieces into play for what is shaping up to be a torrid summer of competition, that could see travellers come out on top and investors pay the price.

title.children: Travellers to win, investors to pay as airlines prepare for price war

image.altText: Energy tower with blue skies and fencing

props.synopsis: Australians struggling to pay their energy bills face 'major inconsistencies' in how retailers respond, a survey of financial counsellors has found. The energy sector is lagging behind banking and water when it comes to supporting customers in hardship.

title.children: The worst-ranked energy retailers when it comes to hardship provisions

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The exchange of missile fire between Israel and Iran has global markets on edge, with equities under pressure and oil and gold in demand. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street tanks, oil soars as markets brace for Middle East conflict

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Why is the oil price surging?
Wall Street drops sharply as Israel and Iran exchange fire, oil surges

image.altText: a burning log

props.synopsis: The felling of what is estimated to be hundreds of tingle trees in a burn last December has sparked fresh calls for a review of prescribed burning in WA.

title.children: WA government steadfast on prescribed burns despite mass tree felling

image.altText: Illustration of a man wearing a cap with electrodes coming out of it, with thought bubbles with different words on turquoise

props.synopsis: Sydney researchers have developed an AI model that can decipher words and sentences from brainwaves detected by a wearable cap. It opens up a new frontier to help patients with cognition, but could also revolutionise how humans interact with computers.

title.children: The science fiction potential of AI supercharging mind-reading technology

image.altText: Man standing in Bali shop with drinks in the background.

props.synopsis: The community of a small Balinese village is reeling after a brutal attack on Saturday killed one Melbourne man and seriously injured another.

title.children: Bali community reels after fatal villa shooting

image.altText: A woman with short hair and a blue shirt looks ahead.

props.synopsis: With more than 100,000 treatment cycles taking place yearly in Australia's growing IVF industry, those with first-hand experience say it's time for changes to increase transparency and simplify regulations.

title.children: As demand for IVF treatment grows, some say 'flat-out busy' labs need closer attention

image.altText: As treet covered in water up to the headlights of cars. On the other side a tow truck.

props.synopsis: The latest advice to engineers and policy makers warns storms will increase in intensity and frequency depending on how quickly the world warms.

title.children: Brisbane not equipped for intense storms of the future, expert warns

image.altText: The silhouette of a soldier is seen firing a machine run at sunset

props.synopsis: Ukraine receives the bodies of another 1,200 Ukrainian soldiers killed in the war with Russia, as part of agreements to exchange both prisoners of war and the dead, Ukrainian officials say.

title.children: Russia hands over 1,200 soldiers' bodies to Ukraine

image.altText: police in camouflage search a suburban area

props.synopsis: The man who allegedly assassinated a US state politician and attempted to kill a state senator had a list of dozens of different targets in his car, police say.

title.children: Minnesota assassin had list of 70 potential targets, police say

image.altText: An orange and white bus with "CDC Melbourne" written on the front parked at a depot under a blue sky.

props.synopsis: Some Victorian commuters will this morning find themselves stranded for the second time in a matter of weeks as bus drivers strike.

title.children: Hundreds of bus drivers walk off job in Victoria

image.altText: Harry Grant of the Queensland Maroons is seen posing for a photograph

props.synopsis: Harry Grant insists he can make it work as a State of Origin starting hooker, despite Queensland losing all four games he has begun on the field and not the bench.

title.children: Grant not concerned with horror Origin starting stat

image.altText: Gloved hand holding a flask of golden liquid fuel inside a lab facility.

props.synopsis: It's tricky to decarbonise airplanes, but a plan to manufacture aviation fuel from canola looks set to take off.

title.children: Farmers could help decarbonise planes with fuel made from canola

image.altText: A generic QPS badge on the wall.

props.synopsis: Police will allege medical examinations found the baby had "extensive injuries" consistent with "prolonged and repeated" abuse.

title.children: Man charged with torture of seven-week-old baby

image.altText: Four students smile at the camera, the middle student shows his phone screen.

props.synopsis: A group of high school students are pushing for change by creating an app prototype that can detect so-called forever chemicals in everyday items.

title.children: Students in PFAS 'hotspot' build app to detect contaminated groceries

image.altText: An adult and a child walking across a pedestrian crossing in a school zone, with the bonnet of a car in the left foreground.

props.synopsis: Canberra mother Veronica Fortune says the road past her local school is an accident waiting to happen. She's written to MLAs about safety improvements and campaigned for adjustments to the roads, but so far nothing has changed.

title.children: Would you accept a 30kph school zone speed limit?

image.altText: An old style two-storey building right on the beach with a grassy hill to its rear.

props.synopsis: Some of the Gold Coast's most influential figures speak out against the council's controversial plan to transform Snapper Rocks' foreshore which could include knocking down the Rainbow Bay Surf Club.

title.children: Surfing champions oppose Gold Coast's plan to redevelop Snapper Rocks

image.altText: a man looks downward pensively

props.synopsis: When Terry Harper first set foot inside the Sydney Opera House it was an "empty cavern". He would spend a lifetime inside its venues making sure every piano note was perfect.

title.children: Opera House piano tuner can barely play but makes every note perfect

image.altText: A body of water with fog rising from the top, and a sun poking over the mountains behind it

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology has forecast minimum temperatures will generally move back towards average in most of the state tomorrow with possible rain in parts of the north.

title.children: Relief ahead for Queensland as big chill to give way to milder weather

image.altText: A person on stage sings into a microphone, set against a backdrop of vibrant red and yellow smoke.

props.synopsis: Best known for his treatment as a child at Don Dale youth detention centre, Dylan Voller is trying to heal from his past by using music and songwriting.

title.children: Dylan Voller is using music to heal from his past

image.altText: A man wearing a white button down shirt, black jeans and large sunglasses walks out of a court building holding papers.

props.synopsis: Canberra 28-year-old Jett Black, who was among a group of detainees that in late 2020 started a prison riot sparked by a lack of cigarettes, no dessert and COVID restrictions, walks free from court.

title.children: Canberra man told to 'make different friends' in prison riot sentencing

image.altText: Bottle of spirits of vodka and whisky are lined a long a shelf.

props.synopsis: Victorian councils want to retain their power of veto over new liquor outlets in country towns amid fierce debate about the links between family violence and access to alcohol.

title.children: Ninth bottle shop proposed for Swan Hill as councils lose veto power
